intro: Senecio asper, commonly known as the roughleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy leaves that give it its common name, and it produces yellow to orange flowers. Senecio asper is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage and blooms.
